snippet: An amnesty program for the Taliban has produced many disillusioned former insurgents with trouble finding work and a sense the government has let them down.
abstract: Interviews with more than dozen former Afghan insurgents find group embittered and torn about their choice to enlist in amnesty program for Taliban, due to fact that many are unable to work and often unable to return to their villages for safety reasons.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Mehtar Lam, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar.

lead_paragraph: An amnesty program for the Taliban has produced many disillusioned former insurgents with trouble finding work and a sense the government has let them down.

headline.seo: Many Afghan Ex-Insurgents Regret Laying Down Arms
headline.main: Afghan Amnesty Program Falls Short, Leaving Ex-Insurgents Regretful and Angry
headline.print_headline: Afghan Amnesty Program Falls Short, Leaving Ex-Insurgents Regretful and Angry
